snippet: The decision spurred an outcry from business groups who said they feared family-owned businesses would have to be sold to outside investors to pay tax bills.
abstract: Germany's Federal Constitutional Court strikes down law allowing companies to be passed from generation to generation tax free, creating backlash among business groups.
lead_paragraph: The decision spurred an outcry from business groups who said they feared family-owned businesses would have to be sold to outside investors to pay tax bills.

headline.main: German Court Strikes Down Law Allowing Companies to Be Inherited Tax-Free
headline.print_headline: German Court Strikes Down Tax-Free Company Transfers
